intro: Roccardia chlorocephala, commonly known as the green-headed roccardia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Roccardia chlorocephala is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
